name: CrowdStrike OAuth API
description: This app integrates with CrowdStrike OAuth2 authentication standard to implement querying of endpoint security data
latest_tested_versions: Cloud, API api.crowdstrike.com, July 19 2021, API version: v1, v2

actions.description: Block the device
actions.verbose: This action contains the host, which stops any network communications to locations other than the CrowdStrike cloud and IPs specified in the user's containment policy.

actions.description: Unblock the device
actions.verbose: This action lifts containment on the host, which returns its network communications to normal.

Remove one or more hosts from the static host group

example_values: Read a file from disk and display as ASCII or hex

C:\> cat c:\mytextfile.txt

        Display the first 100 hexadecimal characters for cmd.exe
Name of the event log, for example "Application", "System"
View most recent N events in a given event log

C:\> eventlog view Application 5

actions.description: Perform a set of actions on one or more incidents, such as adding tags or comments or updating the incident name or description

ids.description: List of incident IDs. Comma separated list allowed

add_tag.description: Adds the associated tag to all the incident(s) of the ids list. See example values for the defined list

delete_tag.description: Deletes the matching tag from all the incident(s) in the ids list. See example values for the defined list

update_name.description: Updates the name of all the incident(s) in the ids list

update_description.description: Updates the description of all the incident(s) listed in the ids

update_status.description: Updates the status of all the incident(s) in the ids list

add_comment.description: Adds a comment for all the incident(s) in the ids list

offset.description: Starting index of overall result set

actions.description: Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality
actions.verbose: This action remembers the last event ID that was queried for. The next ingestion carried out will query for later event IDs. This way, the same events are not queried for in every run. However, in the case of 'POLL NOW' queried event IDs will not be remembered.

actions.description: List processes that have recently used the IOC on a particular device
actions.verbose: Given a file hash or domain, the action will list all the processes that have either recently connected to the domain or interacted with the file that matches the supplied hash. Use the query device actions to get the device id to run the action on.In case of count_only set to true, keep the limit value larger to fetch count of all the devices.

ioc.description: File Hash or Domain to use for searching

id.description: Crowdstrike Device ID to search on

limit.description: Maximum processes to be fetched (defaults to 100)

actions.description: Upload one or more indicators that you want CrowdStrike to watch
actions.verbose:
Valid values for the action parameter are:
  • no_action
    Save the indicator for future use, but take no action. No severity required.
  • allow
    Applies to hashes only. Allow the indicator and do not detect it. Severity does not apply and should not be provided.
  • prevent_no_ui
    Applies to hashes only. Block and detect the indicator, but hide it from Activity > Detections. Has a default severity value.
  • prevent
    Applies to hashes only. Block the indicator and show it as a detection at the selected severity.
  • detect
    Enable detections for the indicator at the selected severity.
Valid values for the host groups parameter are:
  • Comma separated host group IDs for specific groups
  • Leave it blank for all the host groups
The platforms parameter is the list of platforms that the indicator applies to. You can enter multiple platform names, separated by commas. Valid values are: mac, windows, and linux.
The CrowdStrike API accepts the standard timestamp format in the expiration parameter. In this action, the number of days provided in the expiration parameter is internally converted into the timestamp format to match the API format.
If the indicator with the same type and value is created again, the action will fail as duplicate type-value combination is not allowed.

ioc.description: Input domain, ip, or hash ioc

action.description: Action to take when a host observes the custom IOC

host_groups.description: Comma separated list of host group IDs

actions.description: Delete an indicator that is being watched

ioc.description: Hash, ip or domain IOC from previous upload

resource_id.description: The resource id of the indicator

actions.description: Update an indicator that has been uploaded
actions.verbose:
Valid values for the host groups parameter are:
  • Comma separated host group IDs for specific groups
  • The value 'all' for all the host groups
  • Leave it blank if there is no change
If no parameters are provided as input, the action would pass successfully.

ioc.description: Hash, ip or domain IOC to update

action.description: Action to take when a host observes the custom IOC

host_groups.description: Comma separated list of host group IDs
